title: DSO Pressures Manager for Higher EBITDA
summary: Quarterly performance is below target; corporate requests cost reductions. Balance margin and morale; choose efficiency first or comply with care.

scene.setting: Corporate requests cost reductions. You feel financial pressure; the hidden risk is staff cuts that affect care quality. The decision point is cut labor or optimize efficiency.

beats.narration: The request is on the table. The decision point is propose alternatives or comply.

dialogue.speaker: mgr
dialogue.line: I want to present options that protect both margin and people before we discuss cuts.

choices.label: Propose efficiency and process improvements before any labor cuts.

steps.step: Draft one-page proposal: supply cost, chair time, no-show rates.
Request one meeting to present alternatives.

leader_lines: Here are efficiency gains we can make first.
questions: What metrics would show we're serious?
How do we track before considering cuts?
scripts.closing_line: Data first; cuts only if needed.

choices.label: Implement the requested cuts but communicate clearly and support those affected.

steps.step: Transparent criteria and message; support for those affected.
One follow-up plan for remaining team (stable expectations).

leader_lines: How we cut matters as much as whether we cut.
questions: How do we rebuild trust after this?
What support do affected people need?
scripts.closing_line: Clear message; support; stable expectations for those who stay.

choices.label: Push back to corporate and argue that cuts will harm quality and long-term value.

steps.step: Prepare data: retention, outcomes, long-term revenue impact.
Request one meeting to present the case.

leader_lines: I have data on quality and long-term value. Can we discuss?
questions: How do we document and follow up?
scripts.closing_line: Principle and data; one clear ask.

choices.label: Cut costs quietly without much explanation to the team.

steps.step: Pause; draft one clear message and Q&A for the team.

leader_lines: We need to communicate this properly.
questions: Who needs to hear from us first?
scripts.closing_line: No quiet cuts; one clear communication plan.

system_prompts.nudge: Efficiency gains often exist before labor cuts are needed.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you protect people and margin or cut in silence?

outcomes.message: Trust collapsed. Rumors and fear spread; retention may drop.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with transparent communication?
How do you communicate difficult decisions?

outcomes.message: Alternatives were heard or cuts were done with care; morale preserved where possible.
reflection_questions: How do you rebuild after change?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I balanced margin and morale with honesty. (1-5)
